Home.text_1: Welcome to our Climate Quiz! The aim of this quiz is to test your knowledge of climate change and its solutions, while demystifying certain preconceived ideas. We want to help you distinguish between false information and real climate solutions. Get ready to plunge into the world of climate with instructive and engaging questions. Each question will address a specific aspect of climate change, from greenhouse gas emissions to sustainable solutions.
Home.text_2: You'll be asked a series of questions. You'll have to answer them by choosing the answer that seems most appropriate to you. At the end of the quiz, you'll be able to see your results. But be careful! Your choices have consequences and will have a positive or negative impact on the health of your planet.

About.title: About us
About.text: Welcome to The Meuch! We're a dynamic team of passionate Meuchers. Together, we form a tight-knit Meuch, working hard to spread Meuchitude and achieve our common goals. Join us in our Meuch adventure!

Game.question: What would be the temperature of the Earth without an atmosphere?
Game.information: Fortunately, the natural phenomenon of the greenhouse effect retains some of the sun's heat in the atmosphere!

Game.question: Which gas has the most powerful greenhouse effect?
Game.information: Water vapor contributes 60% to the greenhouse effect. However, human emissions of this gas through industry have limited effects as the lifespan of water vapor is short.

Game.question: In winter and in equal quantity, which of these foods emits the most CO2?
Game.information: In equal quantity, producing a tomato in winter generates more CO2 today than transporting other foods...

Game.question: Which country has the highest greenhouse gas emissions per capita?
The production of energy is our main source of CO2 emissions. What is the second?
Game.information: It is deforestation, which accounts for about 15% of our emissions today.

Game.question: In terms of transportation, which action would have the most impact?
answers: Launch a major plan to promote bike taxis
Build a global network of high-speed trains
Game.information: Air transport remains one of the major sources of the increase in our carbon footprint, according to the project.

Game.question: If all the energy I consumed was of human origin, how many humans would I need in my service?
Game.information: This is the argument taken up by many advocates of degrowth!

Game.question: In terms of food, which solution is the most effective?
answers: Install 'clean' cooking stoves in developing countries
Implement a more efficient and sustainable rice cultivation
Game.information: Eating less meat would be the most effective solution according to scientists from the project.

Game.question: Which action would allow me to reduce my carbon footprint the most?
answers: Postpone the purchase of a new smartphone by a year

Game.information: But feel free to follow the other suggestions, it can't hurt...

Game.question: Geologists debate the emergence of a new geological era marked by human influence on the planet, especially through the use of fossil fuels. It is called:
At the current rate of consumption worldwide, 3 billion barrels of oil are consumed in:
How much CO2 does the average American emit into the atmosphere annually?
Game.information: For comparison, on average, a French person emits about 6.9 tonnes of CO2 into the atmosphere annually.

Game.question: In its warming forecasts, the IPCC struggles to estimate the effects of a phenomenon due to a lack of scientific knowledge. It is about:
Game.information: It is much simpler to estimate the aesthetics of Donald Trump's next haircut.

Game.question: The worst-case scenario of the IPCC predicts an increase of:
Game.information: The Earth would be hardly livable, but it remains the worst-case scenario in which we agree to truly mess things up!

Game.question: Where will the first major impacts of climate change occur?
Game.information: The IPCC models agree in showing that the average temperature increases will be significantly more important in the high latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere.
